sub_title: Trainer UX Academy, Co-owner Rubylibre // Digital Design Agency
summary:
As an experienced digital professional, I am passionate about online communication in all its facets. During the past 20+ years, I learned about all the aspects involved, ranging from user research to concept development and from project management to backend implementation and adoption. For me, satisfaction comes from analyzing complex problem while involving business and users, and then come to a sustainable solution with contributions from all specialists involved. A solution that meets both business needs and user needs. Open-minded and curious, I listen and observe before acting. I strongly belief in the power of teams to create the best solutions; group discussions, critiques and solid research are fundamental to reach the next level. My strength lies in aligning, challenging and motivating the team members, and in extracting results from the process: as a conceptual thinker, I make sure the dots are connected.

Specialties
UX research & design, online strategy and content strategy, concept development, requirements analysis, interaction design, copywriting

Some of the organizations I worked for:
ABP, AFM, Albeda College, ANWB, ASR, Barco, BNG Bank, DNB, DSM, Eneco, Espria, Essent, Gamma, Gemiva-SVG, GS1, Holland International Distribution Council, IBFD, KNHB, KPMG, KPN, Marktplaats.nl, MoneYou, MSN, Nationale-Nederlanden, Natuurmonumenten, NDC Mediagroep, New Heroes, Nuon, NWO, Rabobank, Radboud Universiteit, ROC van Amsterdam, Royal Reesink, Slachtofferhulp Nederland, Staatsloterij, Teva Pharmaceuticals, ThiemeMeulenhoff, TNT Innight, Universiteit Maastricht, Vesteda, Vimpelcom, ZonMw

projects.title: UX-design and development of a communityplatform for (former) students of the ROC van Amsterdam
projects.description: For the ROC of Amsterdam MBO College Zuidoost I conducted a UX study into the feasibility of a community platform for (former) students. After finishing the research phase, I organized workshops to co-create the concept for the platform, after which I validated this concept with the target audiences. The next step was the continuous development of this platform, where I act as project leader and my colleagues take care of design and engineering.

contributors.headline: Trainer UX Academy, Co-owner Rubylibre // Digital Design Agency

projects.title: Design system (UX-design, visual design and frontend code) for all websites for Teva Pharmaceuticals
projects.description:
I'm leading a team consisting of visual designers and frontend developers to deliver ongoing design support for Teva Pharmaceuticals, a pharma multinational. We provide UX-design, visual design and the frontend code for their global website, 50+ country sites and numerous product sites. For this, we work in an international setting, collaborating closely with the global Teva digital team located in Israel, the backend supplier located in Bulgaria and the local Teva digital teams. We have setup and maintain the design system.

Design should, in our age of different devices, be delivered in working frontend code, as to guarantee that everything is working as designed on all devices. Furthermore, this code has to be accompanied by clear instructions regarding functionality, interactions and content architecture. By delivering the design in the fashion as described above, the handover to the technical partner that is responsible for the implementation in Episerver, is more straightforward. It saves time in communication and in art direction after implementation.

But delivering a design was, in our opinion, not enough. What was needed, was an underlying System that is also suited for continuous improvement: this is a Library containing all current elements. To this online and secure Library, new elements are easily added. Because over time, new components and templates are needed, others are modified, functionality is changed, and content needs to be developed. The countries should be able to count on the global digital team to adapt to their changing needs. Each improvement, whether initiated by a country or by the global digital team, benefits all country sites.

contributors.headline: Trainer UX Academy, Co-owner Rubylibre // Digital Design Agency

projects.title: UX-optimization for the My GS1 environment
projects.description:
I went through a process of defining and detailing the ideal user experience of the My GS1 environment with both employees and customers of GS1.

GS1 Nederland is the company behind the barcodes you see on all the products in the shops. But the organisation also provides the infrastructure on which suppliers can unambiguously share their product data with their customers and ultimately with the consumer.

The quality of the data in the database of a number of suppliers still leaves much to be desired. To address this, GS1 set up the Data Quality 2.0 program. Icollaborated with GS1 to develop a vision to further improve the data quality program. This included improving the operation of the My GS1 environment.

To optimise the process of improving data quality, I thoroughly studied the user experience of the portal - as well as the data entry process and quality assurance in general.

To obtain an accurate impression of the users and their needs, I started with interactive workshops. The workshops I led resulted in personas and customer journey maps for two target audiences for two industry sectors. These formed the basis for further user research in the form of in-depth interviews.

Based on this research, I issued a series of recommendations for improving the journey and the My GS1 environment. These recommendations were split into ‘quick wins’ and fundamental issues that needed to be addressed.

I subsequently created an elaborate interaction design for the My GS1 environment that includes the fundamental proposals for improvement. Extensive qualitative user testing led to the fine-tuning of the interaction design. I chose for an internal and an external test, first by the GS1 organisation itself and subsequently by its customers.

This resulted in a final interaction design that was passed on to GS1's external technical partner for implementation. Additional measurements of the use of the My GS1 environment will contribute to a process of continuous improvement.

projects.title: Digital workplace for NWO
projects.description: The Nederlandse Organisatie voor Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek, which funds scientific research, was in the middle of a fusion. To facilitate the new organization, NWO invested in a new digital workplace. When the strategy phase was finished, I was responsible for the design phase, delivering a complete frontend library, containing all HTML, CSS and Javascript. I continued to advise NWO during the technical realization and after the go live.

profile_positions.description:
User experience design and writing, strategy and concept development, online communication consultancy, client contact and project management.

Clients include(d) Holland International Distribution Council, Intergamma, Izico Food Group, GS1, New Heroes, NSCR, NWO, Staan Finance, Stek Advocaten and Teva Pharmaceutical Ltd.
profile_positions.title: UX lead, Co-owner

profile_positions.description:
Management of (content)strategy and design projects, improvement of procedures and workflows, pitching. Clients included Albeda College, ANWB, Barco, BNG Bank, CCV, Eneco, Espria, Gemiva-SVG, KNHB, Radboud Universiteit, Reesink Group, Vesteda and Vimpelcom.

I developed the content strategy proposition. With our new model we did content strategy projects for organizations like ANWB, Radboud University and Eneco. I led content strategy workshops, als in-house. Furthermore, I wrote a series of articles on the subject.

I developed the project methodology Entopic Roadmap, which we used for website and intranet projects. Due to the methodology, we were able to realize ambitious projects with good results and without delays.

I co-led the workshop ‘Moving your intranet project forward’ tijdens het IntraTeam Event 2015 in Kopenhagen, Denemarken.

Presentation on the role of content in the development of websites at the Webredactie and content marketing congres 2015.

Presentation on content strategy for intranet at the Congres Intranet 2016.

I facilitated workshops on Content Strategy in Amsterdam (also in-company).
 
I wrote a chapter on Content Strategy for Intranet for the 2017 Intranets - handbook for intranet managers.

I wrote the Intranet Monitor 2017.
